Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky brown (partly worn) below; exterior: slip partly worn; part of brown line just below rim, reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5
Curator's comments: ɸ5 is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. The lack of decoration on the exterior surface of the sherd may be a result of the sherd's size. The decoration on the exterior surface of Chalice Style(including patterned) vases is not usually extensive and filling ornament, with the exception of a simple rim pattern, a single elaborate rosette and simple handle zone pattern, is absent.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0917) (phase 2)
